main event: On the evening of 16 January 1958, Mr. and Mrs. Columbus, Georgia, sighted and reported a UFOB over the Columbus-Ft Benning, Georgia, area. The object was first observed at approximately 1900 hours and disappeared from sight at 2000 hours. It appeared and reappeared, moved rapidly from one point to another, and was described as illuminated, changing colors and seemingly giving off sparks.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for an hour, during which the object demonstrated rapid movement and changing colors.
The object was described as cigar-shaped and oblong, with a bright orange-white radiance.
The objects were initially compared to the size of a C-97 aircraft and looked like sunlight on a small cloud as the sun went down.
The witnesses included both civilians and military personnel stationed at Fort Benning, adding credibility to the sighting.

Although the investigating officer suggested the objects could be a formation of U.S. Air Force or government agency aircraft, or an atmospheric phenomenon, there was no physical evidence to support this conclusion.
sighted object: Cigar-shaped and oblong illuminated object demonstrating rapid movement and color changes
witnesses: Mr. and Mrs. Columbus, Georgia, and a Sgt. from Fort Benning, Georgia, Army Infantry Human Research Unit
